entities: un declaration on the rights of indigenous peoples

level 1.Description: Indigenous energy sovereignty addresses energy inequality by empowering indigenous communities to have control over their energy resources.
Indigenous energy sovereignty employs traditional knowledge to develop sustainable energy solutions rooted in indigenous practices.
Indigenous energy sovereignty collaborates with renewable energy companies to promote the use of clean and sustainable energy sources in indigenous communities.
Indigenous energy sovereignty supports community-led energy projects to empower indigenous communities in managing their energy resources.
Indigenous energy sovereignty administers energy access programs to ensure equitable and affordable energy access for indigenous communities.
Indigenous energy sovereignty measures the cultural impact of energy projects to ensure the preservation of indigenous heritage and practices.

level 1.Object: un declaration on the rights of indigenous peoples
level 1.Description: Indigenous energy sovereignty aligns with the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples to promote and protect the rights of indigenous communities in relation to energy resources.
Indigenous energy sovereignty is an instance of sustainable energy governance that emphasizes the rights and participation of indigenous communities in energy decision-making.
